intro: Cabralea microcalyx, commonly known as the dwarf cabralea, is a small evergreen shrub native to the eastern Andes of South America. It features dense, leathery foliage with elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
